snippet: Weak margins in refining hurt results at the largest European and American oil companies.
abstract: Royal Dutch Shell reports third-quarter net income of $4.7 billion, down 35 percent from year-earlier period; Exxon Mobil reports third-quarter net income of $7.87 billion, down 18 percent from year-earlier period; both companies cite weaker profit margins in refining and a sluggish global economy.

byline.original: By CLIFFORD KRAUSS and STANLEY REED
byline.contributor: Clifford Krauss reported from Houston and Stanley Reed from London.

lead_paragraph: Weak margins in refining hurt results at the largest European and American oil companies.

headline.main: Profit Margins Squeeze Exxon Mobil and Shell
headline.print_headline: Profits Dive at Exxon Mobil and Shell
